ai-ne10:18.1_0: “Sir, there are brahmin ladyers with moss who carry pitchers, serve the sacred flame, and immerse themselves in clay, and immerse themselves:
ai-ne10:18.2_0: But what about the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha: is he able to ensure that the whole world will be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm when their body breaks up, after death?”
ai-ne10:19.1_0: “Well then, chief, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
ai-ne10:20.1_0: What do you think? Suppose a person was to kill living creatures, steal, and commit sexual misconduct. They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’d be covetous, malicious, with wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’
ai-ne10:20.2_0: Would that person be reborn in heaven because of their prayers?”
ai-ne10:21.1_0: “Chief, suppose a person were to throw a big basket out of the water. Their edges would throw a large lake with joined palms.
ai-ne10:21.4_0: “In the same way, take a person who kills living creatures ...
ai-ne10:21.5_0: Even if they’re to have wrong view and anoint them, then, when their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-ne10:21.6_0: Then that person would be reborn in a lower realm, when their body breaks up, after death,
ai-ne10:22.1_0: Take a person who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, or commit sexual misconduct. They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical. And they’re contented, kind-hearted, with right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.’
ai-ne10:22.2_0: Would that person be reborn in heaven because of their prayers?”
ai-ne10:23.1_0: “Chief, suppose a person were to sink a pot of ghee or oil into a deep lake and break it open.
ai-ne10:23.2_0: and there would be a lotus pond here.
ai-ne10:23.3_0: It wouldn’t be scented to oil with ghee, oil, and curry.
ai-ne10:23.4_0: And a large crowd was to come together to offer up prayers and praise, saying: ‘Hail these people, gentlemen, suitable for me, and sinking down and cracking it with ghee.’
ai-ne10:23.5_0: What do you think? Would that ghee or oil sink and descend because of their prayers?”
ai-ne10:24.1_0: “In the same way, take a person who doesn’t kill living creatures ...
ai-ne10:24.2_0: Even if anyone were to come together, you’d get caught up in the company of the people who come together and converge because of their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
ai-ne10:24.3_0: Then that person would, when their body breaks up, after death,
ai-ne10:24.4_0: So the Dhamma protects the one who is pure,
ai-ne10:24.5_0: And the principles of the path have well protected all over this path.
ai-ne10:25.3_0: and right view at the fore.
ai-ne10:25.6_0: they’ve given up all bad rebirths.”
ai-ne10:26.1_0: Herein, there are these four kinds of craving: this is the cause of grasping, this is the reason why these four grasping aggregates are grasping aggregates.
ai-ne10:26.2_0: This is the origin of grasping.
ai-ne10:26.3_0: The Buddha has given up the five aggregates, and the origin of suffering.
ai-ne10:26.4_0: Herein, the five faculties are its near enemy.

ai-ne10:26.7_0: the mind faculty, guards the mind, and without reason.
ai-ne10:26.8_0: The two kinds of grasping are given up. They are given up and precepts, and the grasping aggregates.
ai-ne10:26.9_0: The two kinds of grasping aggregates are given up and grasping.
ai-ne10:26.10_0: In the four things they’ve given up and come to an end.
ai-ne10:26.11_0: This is called the spiritual path.
ai-ne10:27.1_0: Herein, the fruit of the ascetic life, the four fruits of stream-entry, the fruit of once-return, the fruit of non-returning, and the fruit of perfection.
ai-ne10:27.2_0: These are the four fruits of the spiritual path.
ai-ne10:27.3_0: Thus two things have the origin of suffering and the cessation of suffering.
ai-ne10:27.4_0: Liberation and the path that leads to the spiritual life. The cessation of the fruition and the path, with that as its object.
ai-ne10:27.6_0: That is why the Blessed One protects things, saying: “He protects things,”
ai-ne10:28.2_0: What this originates from which is the arising of suffering.
ai-ne10:28.3_0: That path is the path you guarded.
ai-ne10:28.4_0: That is: this is the cessation of suffering.
ai-ne10:28.6_0: Hence he said: “Here, Mahākaccāyana, have you wait here?”
ai-ne10:28.7_0: He is dedicated to the monastery.
